intro: Stichorkis merapiensis, commonly known as the Merapi orchid, is a rare and endemic species found in the mountainous regions of Java, Indonesia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
